meanings.definition: Not straight or level; slanting or sloping.
meanings.sent1: The angled roof allowed rainwater to flow easily.
meanings.sent2: The road took an angled turn around the hill.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to climb the angled tree but kept slipping down.
meanings.sent4: Her angled smile hinted at a hidden agenda.
meanings.sent5: The angled shadows created a mysterious atmosphere in the room.

meanings.definition: To move or be placed at an angle.
meanings.sent1: She angled the mirror to get a better view.
meanings.sent2: He angled his chair towards the TV for a comfortable position.
meanings.sent3: The fish angled towards the bait cautiously.
meanings.sent4: He angled his argument to win over the audience.
meanings.sent5: She angled her shot perfectly to hit the target.

meanings.definition: To present or view from a particular perspective.
meanings.sent1: The photographer angled the camera for a unique shot.
meanings.sent2: He angled his proposal to highlight its benefits.
meanings.sent3: She angled her story to make it more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The artist angled the painting to capture the sunset perfectly.
meanings.sent5: He angled his speech to appeal to a wider audience.
